intro: Otiophora scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed puccoon, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Otiophora scabra is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in full sun. Its medicinal properties have been explored for their potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic benefits.
